Iran footballer Ramin Rezian crying after his team's defeat in the World Cup. (AFP Photo)

articles.title: "Who Would've Thought...": Iranians Celebrate Team's Loss At World Cup - NDTV
articles.description: The Iran football team's defeat by the US in the FIFA World Cup on Wednesday triggered unusual celebrations in their home country, sharply contrasting with the reaction expected after any national football team's loss.
articles.content:
Protests have since raged through the nation, challenging the authority of the government.

articles.author: TN Sports Desk
articles.title: Samson averages 66 but still on bench: Shashi Tharoor levels seething criticism after Pant gets another chance - Times Now
articles.description: Congress Member of Parliament from Thiruvananthapuram, Shashi Tharoor levelled seething criticism against Indian team management after Sanju Samson stayed on the bench yet again as the Men in Blue went unchanged for the third ODI against New Zealand​.
articles.content:

articles.author: Osman Samiuddin
articles.title: At 56, Wasim Akram is turning his thoughts to his legacy - ESPNcricinfo
articles.description: By not always being one thing all the time since he retired, he has become omnipresent in a way that contrasts with how Imran Khan is famous
articles.content: Akram rings the bell at Old Trafford during the 2020 Pakistan Test there. Of all the things you might accuse him of, not being around is not one  •  Gareth Copley/Getty Images
